channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Typhoon Gaemi Approaches Taiwan as Hundreds of Flights Are Canceled
item.description: Typhoon Gaemi, nearing the island with Category 4 winds, was expected to make landfall Wednesday night after killing at least five people in the region.

item.title: Typhoon Gaemi Approaches Taiwan as Hundreds of Flights Are Canceled
item.description: Typhoon Gaemi, nearing the island with Category 4 winds, was expected to make landfall Wednesday night after killing at least five people in the region.

item.title: Kenya launched a fertilizer subsidy in 2008 and now farmers say the soil is dying and chemical fertilizers that make the land acidic are to blame
item.description: About 63% of arable land in Kenya is now acidic, according to the agriculture ministry, which has been recording a decline in production of staples such as maize and leading exports of horticulture and tea.

item.title: Harris Hits Campaign Trail, and Netanyahu Heads to Congress
item.description: Plus, U.S. to host 2034 Winter Olympics.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Netanyahu Under Pressure to Address Cease-Fire Calls in His Speech to Congress
item.description: Families of hostages in Gaza and many others in Israel and abroad will be watching the Israeli prime minister’s address on Wednesday to hear how he will handle competing demands on his approach to the war.

item.title: A quarter of bosses admit their return-to-office mandates were meant to make staff quit
item.description: The report from BambooHR concludes what many workers have long suspected: RTO mandates are layoffs in disguise.

item.title: Salt Lake City Will Host 2034 Winter Olympics
item.description: The Utah capital’s victory was ratified only after Olympic officials threatened to pull the Games if the U.S. authorities undermined the World Anti-Doping Agency.

item.title: Salt Lake City Will Host 2034 Winter Olympics
item.description: The Utah capital’s victory was ratified only after Olympic officials threatened to pull the Games if the U.S. authorities undermined the World Anti-Doping Agency.

item.title: Budget airline EasyJet sells an extra 1.5 million tickets with profits up 16% as its summer looks vastly different from struggling rival Ryanair
item.description: EasyJet’s CEO Johan Lundgren said the company was “on track to deliver another record-breaking summer.”

item.title: Black Voters Feel Excited, and Worried, about a Kamala Harris Campaign
item.description: In interviews around the country, Black voters voiced enthusiasm for the reshaped campaign. They also worried about how a polarized country would see it.

item.title: Nepal Plane Crash Kills 18 People After Takeoff
item.description: The pilot of the Saurya Airlines flight, which was departing from Kathmandu, was the only survivor, officials said.

item.title: Explosion and fire at Mexican tequila factory kills at least 5
item.description: Víctor Hugo Roldán, the state Civil Protection director, said two of the factory's 219,000-liter tequila vats ruptured and authorities were working to ensure no alcohol spilled into the municipal drainage network.

item.title: Meet the Woman Leading Venezuela’s Opposition to Maduro
item.description: Spurned by the country’s authoritarian president and even her own colleagues in the opposition, María Corina Machado has built the most significant voter mobilization since Hugo Chávez.

item.title: Hepatitis A and Other Diseases Surge Among Gaza’s Displaced, U.N. Says
item.description: More than 100,000 people are suspected to have contracted hepatitis A, while polio, a disease that has been eradicated in much of the world, is now present there, according to the World Health Organization.

item.title: Donald Trump told the Fed not to cut rates before the election—but Wall Street is convinced he won’t get his way
item.description: "The market is now pricing in more than two 25-basis-point rate cuts by year-end, including a near-100% chance of a September cut."
